data.name: GLOBAL Dark Style: Wombat Style (Firefox/Mozilla)
data.description: My fork of "Global dark style - changes everything to DARK" that tweaks things a bit more the way I like them for usability. This is not a dark solarized or zenburn or or or, though I draw from all of those a bit. I have also begun to ad an anti-anti-ad blocker bit, though I will probably spin that off into another style. The wombat thing is just because I like wombats. Sorry, currently styled for Firefox/Iceweasel only. Updated as I find and fix things. Please note that I use a separate dark style for Google services (including YouTube), Facebook, and my own darker UI for Remember the Milk. Those change too frequently for me to keep them as part of this style.

user.name: Steven Saus
user.about: Steven Saus injects people with radioactivity as his day job, but only to serve the forces of good. He is an author, sociologist, occasional coder, and nuclear medicine technologist living in Dayton, Ohio. His first venture into writing and publishing was while in second grade using a mimeograph machine. He has been writing ever since. He blogs at Ideatrash.

YouTube Fullscreen Live Stream w/ Chat Room
data.description: Press F11 and enjoy the fullscreen goodness of YouTube live streams with chat room. YouTube's chat room design leaves a lot to be desired, but this code allows for a more enjoyable experience.

data.name: Darklingo++
data.description: Hey! Darklingo++ is a delightful switch on the default Duolingo UI. This style presents you with a Dark Mode, the ability to change the Theme Color , and it makes both leagues and the scrollbar optional. (More to come in the future) If you find anything that isn't themed correctly, feel free to tell me; feedback is always welcome! And if you really like this style or any of my others, you can donate (only if you want to ). Made with by Justin Ikeako.

data.name: Tumblr Dashboard - I'll Be There for You
data.description: Fully updated to work with Tumblrs code update of July 2020, this is a simple yet elegant recolouring of the dashboard as to appease those whod rather stray from the traditional blue. Heavily inspired by the Black Dashboard once offered by Tumblr back in 2010 to raise awareness for the BP Oil Spill, I also took the liberty of polishing it, working with more padding and spacing as to create a more relaxed viewing. This is accompanied by a unified font size and an altered line height.
